TEXT.English: The Light Emitting Diode (LED) Incapacitator is a weapon designed like a flashlight. It emits an extremely bright, rapid, and well-focused series of 'differently-colored random pulses.' Before the human eyes can focus in on one frequency, another frequency comes on, causing intracranial pressure, which results in cluster headaches, nausea, vomiting, disorientation, irritability, and visual impairment to the target (opponent).[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The Light Emitting Diode (LED) Incapacitator is a weapon designed like a flashlight. It emits an extremely bright, rapid, and well-focused series of 'differently-colored random pulses.' Before the human eyes can focus in on one frequency, another frequency comes on, causing intracranial pressure, which results in cluster headaches, nausea, vomiting, disorientation, irritability, and visual impairment to the target (opponent).[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: 'The Library of Babel' (Spanish: La biblioteca de Babel) is a short story by Argentine author and librarian Jorge Luis Borges (1899-1986), conceiving of a universe in the form of a vast library containing all possible 410-page books of a certain format and character set.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: 'The Library of Babel' (Spanish: La biblioteca de Babel) is a short story by Argentine author and librarian Jorge Luis Borges (1899-1986), conceiving of a universe in the form of a vast library containing all possible 410-page books of a certain format and character set.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Naturally, Man should want to stand on his own two feet... but how can he when his own machines cut the ground out from under him?[PARAGRAPH:2]http://lineshapespace.com/lights-out-manufacturing/
TEXT.French: Naturally, Man should want to stand on his own two feet... but how can he when his own machines cut the ground out from under him?[PARAGRAPH:2]http://lineshapespace.com/lights-out-manufacturing/

TEXT.English: These Lilliputians are small because they are made of femtomaterials.
TEXT.French: These Lilliputians are small because they are made of femtomaterials.

TEXT.English: In extremely cold environments, liquid nitrogen could theoretically be a solvent for life forms.
TEXT.French: In extremely cold environments, liquid nitrogen could theoretically be a solvent for life forms.

TEXT.English: The buildings are now composed of biological material which can be genetically engineered to desired specifications.
TEXT.French: Les bâtiments sont désormais composés de matériel biologique qui peut être génétiquement modifié selon les spécifications souhaitées.

TEXT.English: In physical cosmology, the Big Rip is a hypothetical cosmological model concerning the ultimate fate of the universe, in which the matter of the universe, from stars and galaxies to atoms and subatomic particles, and even spacetime itself, is progressively torn apart by the expansion of the universe at a certain time in the future. According to the hypothesis, first published in 2003, the scale factor of the universe and with it all distances in the universe will become infinite at a finite time in the future. The possibility of sudden singularities and crunch or rip singularities at late times occur only for hypothetical matter with implausible physical properties.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: In physical cosmology, the Big Rip is a hypothetical cosmological model concerning the ultimate fate of the universe, in which the matter of the universe, from stars and galaxies to atoms and subatomic particles, and even spacetime itself, is progressively torn apart by the expansion of the universe at a certain time in the future. According to the hypothesis, first published in 2003, the scale factor of the universe and with it all distances in the universe will become infinite at a finite time in the future. The possibility of sudden singularities and crunch or rip singularities at late times occur only for hypothetical matter with implausible physical properties.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A launch loop or Lofstrom loop is a proposed system for launching objects into space orbit using a moving cable-like system situated inside a sheath attached to the Earth at two ends and suspended above the atmosphere in the middle. The design concept was published by Keith Lofstrom and describes an active structure maglev cable transport system that would be around 2,000 km (1,240 mi) long and maintained at an altitude of up to 80 km (50 mi). A launch loop would be held up at this altitude by the momentum of a belt that circulates around the structure. This circulation, in effect, transfers the weight of the structure onto a pair of magnetic bearings, one at each end, which support it.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: A launch loop or Lofstrom loop is a proposed system for launching objects into space orbit using a moving cable-like system situated inside a sheath attached to the Earth at two ends and suspended above the atmosphere in the middle. The design concept was published by Keith Lofstrom and describes an active structure maglev cable transport system that would be around 2,000 km (1,240 mi) long and maintained at an altitude of up to 80 km (50 mi). A launch loop would be held up at this altitude by the momentum of a belt that circulates around the structure. This circulation, in effect, transfers the weight of the structure onto a pair of magnetic bearings, one at each end, which support it.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The best sports the Solar System has to offer, such as BASE jumping on Miranda.
TEXT.French: The best sports the Solar System has to offer, such as BASE jumping on Miranda.

TEXT.English: A luminescent solar concentrator (LSC) is a device for concentrating radiation, non-ionizing solar radiation in particular, to produce electricity. Luminescent solar concentrators operate on the principle of collecting radiation over a large area, converting it by luminescence (commonly specifically by fluorescence) and directing the generated radiation into a relatively small output target.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wikipedia
TEXT.French: A luminescent solar concentrator (LSC) is a device for concentrating radiation, non-ionizing solar radiation in particular, to produce electricity. Luminescent solar concentrators operate on the principle of collecting radiation over a large area, converting it by luminescence (commonly specifically by fluorescence) and directing the generated radiation into a relatively small output target.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A permanent change in human psyche, physiology, or nature.
TEXT.French: A permanent change in human psyche, physiology, or nature.

TEXT.English: This rotating habitat adds artificial centrifugal gravity to the moon's natural gravity to create an environment that feels closer to natural gravity.
TEXT.French: This rotating habitat adds artificial centrifugal gravity to the moon's natural gravity to create an environment that feels closer to natural gravity.
Usine Lunaire de production de biens

TEXT.English: A lunar outpost was an element of the George W. Bush era Vision for Space Exploration, which has been replaced with President Barack Obama's space policy. The outpost would have been an inhabited facility on the surface of the Moon. At the time it was proposed, NASA was to construct the outpost over the five years between 2019 and 2024. The United States Congress directed that the U.S. portion, 'shall be designated the Neil A. Armstrong Lunar Outpost'.[PARAGRAPH:2]On December 4, 2006, NASA announced the conclusion of its Global Exploration Strategy and Lunar Architecture Study. The Lunar Architecture Study's purpose was to 'define a series of lunar missions constituting NASA's Lunar campaign to fulfill the Lunar Exploration elements' of the Vision for Space Exploration. What resulted was a basic plan for a lunar outpost near one of the poles of the Moon, which would permanently house astronauts in six-month shifts. These studies were made before the discovery of water ice (5.6 +- 2.9% by mass) in a polar crater, which may substantially affect plans.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: A lunar outpost was an element of the George W. Bush era Vision for Space Exploration, which has been replaced with President Barack Obama's space policy. The outpost would have been an inhabited facility on the surface of the Moon. At the time it was proposed, NASA was to construct the outpost over the five years between 2019 and 2024. The United States Congress directed that the U.S. portion, 'shall be designated the Neil A. Armstrong Lunaire Outpost'.[PARAGRAPH:2]On December 4, 2006, NASA announced the conclusion of its Global Exploration Strategy and Lunaire Architecture Study. The Lunaire Architecture Study's purpose was to 'define a series of lunar missions constituting NASA's Lunaire campaign to fulfill the Lunaire Exploration elements' of the Vision for Space Exploration. What resulted was a basic plan for a lunar outpost near one of the poles of the Moon, which would permanently house astronauts in six-month shifts. These studies were made before the discovery of water ice (5.6 +- 2.9% by mass) in a polar crater, which may substantially affect plans.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
Raffinerie Lunaire de carburant pour fusée

TEXT.English: The Google Lunar XPRIZE (GLXP), sometimes referred to as Moon 2.0, is an inducement prize space competition organized by XPRIZE, and sponsored by Google. The challenge calls for privately funded spaceflight teams to be the first to land a privately funded robotic spacecraft on the Moon, travel 500 meters, and transmit back high-definition video and images.[PARAGRAPH:2] -Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The Google Lunaire XPRIZE (GLXP), sometimes referred to as Moon 2.0, is an inducement prize space competition organized by XPRIZE, and sponsored by Google. The challenge calls for privately funded spaceflight teams to be the first to land a privately funded robotic spacecraft on the Moon, travel 500 meters, and transmit back high-definition video and images.[PARAGRAPH:2] -Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Robotocratic government for the interstellar colony
TEXT.French: Robotocratic government for the interstellar colony

TEXT.English: The IC 342/Maffei Group (also known as the IC 342 Group or the Maffei 1 Group) is the nearest group of galaxies to the Local Group. The group can be described as a binary group; the member galaxies are mostly concentrated around either IC 342 or Maffei 1, both of which are the brightest galaxies within the group. The group is one of many located within the Virgo Supercluster (i.e. the Local Supercluster).[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

The group can be described as a binary group; the member galaxies are mostly concentrated around either IC 342 or Maffei 1, both of which are the brightest galaxies within the group. The group is one of many located within the Virgo Supercluster (i.e. the Local Supercluster).[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A Magical Land or Another Dimension comprising the collective dreams of humanity. Can be a collective dream, or the dream of a specific person. Generally surreal, nonsensical, and psychologically symbolic. Alternatively, just adorable randomness. Usually divided into two halves or factions-nightmares and good dreams.[PARAGRAPH:2] http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DreamLand

TEXT.French: Manipulation of matter at the quantum level gives rise to phenomena that appear as magic. Magitek armor links this technology to the human brain.

TEXT.English: Your urban core is connected through a series of elevated multidirectional elevators, seamlessly integration intra- and inter-building transportation. This greatly increases efficiency, increases the density of urban living, and takes your cities a step closer to true arcology.[PARAGRAPH:2]https://www.thyssenkrupp.com/en/mediaplayer/MULTI-%E2%80%93-the-world%E2%80%99s-first-rope-free-elevator-system-271.html

TEXT.English: In the first century of human space flight, high launch costs were an insurmountable barrier to full-fledged commercialization and industrialization of space. The advent of reusable rockets in the 2010s helped but were insufficient. Only when governments and private companies applied advanced civil engineering knowledge and abundant power sources to building large maglev launch structures were costs affordable for the general public.
TEXT.French: In the first century of human space flight, high launch costs were an insurmountable barrier to full-fledged commercialization and industrialization of space. The advent of reusable rockets in the 2010s helped but were insufficient. Only when governments and private companies applied advanced civil engineering knowledge and abundant power sources to building large maglev launch structures were costs affordable for the general public.

TEXT.English: Mail order is the buying of goods or services by mail delivery. The buyer places an order for the desired products with the merchant through some remote method such as through a telephone call or web site. Then, the products are delivered to the customer. The products are typically delivered directly to an address supplied by the customer, such as a home address, but occasionally the orders are delivered to a nearby retail location for the customer to pick up. Some merchants also allow the goods to be shipped directly to a third party consumer, which is an effective way to send a gift to an out-of-town recipient.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: La vente par correspondance est l'achat de biens ou de services par livraison postale. L'acheteur passe une commande pour les produits souhaités auprès du marchand par le biais d'une méthode à distance telle que par le biais d'un appel téléphonique ou d'un site Web. Ensuite, les produits sont livrés au client. Les produits sont généralement livrés directement à une adresse fournie par le client, telle qu'une adresse personnelle, mais les commandes sont parfois livrées à un point de vente proche pour que le client puisse les récupérer. Certains commerçants permettent également que les marchandises soient expédiées directement à un tiers consommateur, ce qui est un moyen efficace d'envoyer un cadeau à un destinataire hors de la ville. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Makemake (minor-planet designation 136472 Makemake) is a dwarf planet and perhaps the largest Kuiper belt object (KBO) in the classical population, with a diameter approximately two thirds that of Pluto. Makemake has one known satellite, S/2015 (136472) 1. Makemake's extremely low average temperature, about 30 K (-243.2 C), means its surface is covered with methane, ethane, and possibly nitrogen ices.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Makemake (minor-planet designation 136472 Makemake) is a dwarf planet and perhaps the largest Kuiper belt object (KBO) in the classical population, with a diameter approximately two thirds that of Pluto. Makemake has one known satellite, S/2015 (136472) 1. Makemake's extremely low average temperature, about 30 K (-243.2 C), means its surface is covered with methane, ethane, and possibly nitrogen ices.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The maker culture is a contemporary culture or subculture representing a technology-based extension of DIY culture that intersects with hacker culture (which is less concerned with physical objects as it focuses on software) and revels in the creation of new devices as well as tinkering with existing ones. The maker culture in general supports open-source hardware. Typical interests enjoyed by the maker culture include engineering-oriented pursuits such as electronics, robotics, 3-D printing, and the use of Computer Numeric Control tools, as well as more traditional activities such as metalworking, woodworking, and, mainly, its predecessor, the traditional arts and crafts. The subculture stresses a cut-and-paste approach to standardized hobbyist technologies, and encourages cookbook re-use of designs published on websites and maker-oriented publications. There is a strong focus on using and learning practical skills and applying them to reference designs.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: La culture du créateur est une culture ou une sous-culture contemporaine représentant une extension technologique de la culture du bricolage qui recoupe la culture des pirates (qui se préoccupe moins des objets physiques car elle se concentre sur les logiciels) et se délecte de la création de nouveaux appareils ainsi que du bricolage existantes. La culture du créateur en général prend en charge le matériel open source. Les intérêts typiques de la culture des fabricants incluent les activités d'ingénierie telles que l'électronique, la robotique, l'impression 3D et l'utilisation d'outils de contrôle numérique par ordinateur, ainsi que des activités plus traditionnelles telles que le travail des métaux, le travail du bois et, principalement, son prédécesseur. , les arts et métiers traditionnels. La sous-culture met l'accent sur une approche par copier-coller des technologies standardisées pour les amateurs et encourage la réutilisation des livres de cuisine des conceptions publiées sur des sites Web et des publications destinées aux fabricants. Il y a un fort accent sur l'utilisation et l'apprentissage des compétences pratiques et leur application aux modèles de référence. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A gravity train is a theoretical means of transportation intended to go between two points on the surface of a sphere, following a straight tunnel that goes directly from one point to the other through the interior of the sphere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: A gravity train is a theoretical means of transportation intended to go between two points on the surface of a sphere, following a straight tunnel that goes directly from one point to the other through the interior of the sphere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: This massive manufacturing complex is decked out with 3D printers, CNC machines, and other high-tech gadgetry. It can produce all sorts of goods.
TEXT.French: Ce complexe de fabrication massif est orné d'imprimantes 3D, de machines CNC et d'autres gadgets de haute technologie. Il peut produire toutes sortes de marchandises.

TEXT.English: The Mariner program was a program conducted by the American space agency NASA in conjunction with Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) that launched a series of robotic interplanetary probes designed to investigate Mars, Venus and Mercury from 1962 to 1973. The program included a number of firsts, including the first planetary flyby, the first pictures from another planet, the first planetary orbiter, and the first gravity assist maneuver.[PARAGRAPH:2]Of the ten vehicles in the Mariner series, seven were successful. The planned Mariner Jupiter-Saturn vehicles evolved into Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 of the Voyager program, while the Viking 1 and Viking 2 Mars orbiters were enlarged versions of the Mariner 9 spacecraft. Other Mariner-based spacecraft, launched since Voyager, included the Magellan probe to Venus, and the Galileo probe to Jupiter. A second-generation Mariner spacecraft, called the Mariner Mark II series, eventually evolved into the Cassini-Huygens probe, now in orbit around Saturn.[PARAGRAPH:2]The total cost of the Mariner program was approximately $554 million.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The Mariner program was a program conducted by the American space agency NASA in conjunction with Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) that launched a series of robotic interplanetary probes designed to investigate Mars, Venus and Mercury from 1962 to 1973. The program included a number of firsts, including the first planetary flyby, the first pictures from another planet, the first planetary orbiter, and the first gravity assist maneuver.[PARAGRAPH:2]Of the ten vehicles in the Mariner series, seven were successful. The planned Mariner Jupiter-Saturn vehicles evolved into Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 of the Voyager program, while the Viking 1 and Viking 2 Mars orbiters were enlarged versions of the Mariner 9 spacecraft. Other Mariner-based spacecraft, launched since Voyager, included the Magellan probe to Venus, and the Galileo probe to Jupiter. A second-generation Mariner spacecraft, called the Mariner Mark II series, eventually evolved into the Cassini-Huygens probe, now in orbit around Saturn.[PARAGRAPH:2]The total cost of the Mariner program was approximately $554 million.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Although the first arcologies were built on Earth, Mars was the next natural building site. The low gravity and thin atmosphere allow for monumental architecture that Earthlings cannot even dream of.
TEXT.French: Although the first arcologies were built on Earth, Mars was the next natural building site. The low gravity and thin atmosphere allow for monumental architecture that Earthlings cannot even dream of.

TEXT.English: Using Prototyped Pathogens, your Martian colonists can now develop a thriving biotech industry, producing medicine and better food. With life still a struggle, and emerging plans to terraform the planet, the Martians have given up all pretense of avoiding biological contamination. This decision remains controverial.
TEXT.French: Using Prototyped Pathogens, your Martian colonists can now develop a thriving biotech industry, producing medicine and better food. With life still a struggle, and emerging plans to terraform the planet, the Martians have given up all pretense of avoiding biological contamination. This decision remains controverial.

TEXT.English: After decades of subsistence living in Martian caves and crude 3D printed dugouts, your colony is finally building something that resembles a city. Now there is entertainment, adequate health care, and water that doesn't taste foul. But the more the city looks like Earth, the more you wish that is where you were.
TEXT.French: After decades of subsistence living in Martian caves and crude 3D printed dugouts, your colony is finally building something that resembles a city. Now there is entertainment, adequate health care, and water that doesn't taste foul. But the more the city looks like Earth, the more you wish that is where you were.

TEXT.English: This is your basic Mars colony. It is equipped with the bare essentials: a hydroponic growing kit, a 3D printer, some medical supplies, and a (Martian) year's supply of Tang. The road to Mars was long, strewn with half-starts by governments and private ventures, and a few tragic losses. When the first humans finally arrived, the cheering quickly gave way to the sobering reality of the struggles to survive away from the resources and familiar environment of Earth. The first colonists suffered terrible health problems from low gravity, dust, radiation, and psychological torment. Their initial efforts, exploration and gathering of scientific data, hardly justified the terrible costs. In retrospect, it is amazing that humans pressed on and eventually built thriving cities on Mars and beyond.
TEXT.French: This is your basic Mars colony. It is equipped with the bare essentials: a hydroponic growing kit, a 3D printer, some medical supplies, and a (Martian) year's supply of Tang. The road to Mars was long, strewn with half-starts by governments and private ventures, and a few tragic losses. When the first humans finally arrived, the cheering quickly gave way to the sobering reality of the struggles to survive away from the resources and familiar environment of Earth. The first colonists suffered terrible health problems from low gravity, dust, radiation, and psychological torment. Their initial efforts, exploration and gathering of scientific data, hardly justified the terrible costs. In retrospect, it is amazing that humans pressed on and eventually built thriving cities on Mars and beyond.

TEXT.English: The Cycler system alters the philosophy behind a Mars program. It makes possible the dream of regular flights to the Red Planet and a permanent human presence there. That's the only way we'll ever succeed in taking mankind's next giant leap: a subway-in-the-sky between our planet and our future second home.[PARAGRAPH:2]http://buzzaldrin.com/space-vision/rocket_science/aldrin-mars-cycler/
TEXT.French: The Cycler system alters the philosophy behind a Mars program. It makes possible the dream of regular flights to the Red Planet and a permanent human presence there. That's the only way we'll ever succeed in taking mankind's next giant leap: a subway-in-the-sky between our planet and our future second home.[PARAGRAPH:2]http://buzzaldrin.com/space-vision/rocket_science/aldrin-mars-cycler/

That's the only way we'll ever succeed in taking mankind's next giant leap: a subway-in-the-sky between our planet and our future second home.[PARAGRAPH:2]http://buzzaldrin.com/space-vision/rocket_science/aldrin-mars-cycler/
TEXT.French: The Cycler system alters the philosophy behind a Mars program. It makes possible the dream of regular flights to the Red Planet and a permanent human presence there. That's the only way we'll ever succeed in taking mankind's next giant leap: a subway-in-the-sky between our planet and our future second home.[PARAGRAPH:2]http://buzzaldrin.com/space-vision/rocket_science/aldrin-mars-cycler/

TEXT.English: Using lifeforms with new and exotic biochemistry, scientists began designing small, regional ecosystems. These were the beginnings of the full terraforming of the red planet.
TEXT.French: Using lifeforms with new and exotic biochemistry, scientists began designing small, regional ecosystems. These were the beginnings of the full terraforming of the red planet.

TEXT.English: The first Martian factories were built from a standard rapid prototyping platform that was brought to the Red Planet. At least Mission Control thought of that much. But the machines keep breaking down under unanticipated climatic conditions and insufficient testing in the field. You are not sure whether to complain or be amazed that it works at all.
TEXT.French: The first Martian factories were built from a standard rapid prototyping platform that was brought to the Red Planet. At least Mission Control thought of that much. But the machines keep breaking down under unanticipated climatic conditions and insufficient testing in the field. You are not sure whether to complain or be amazed that it works at all.

TEXT.English: For more than a century after colonization began, Martians had to content themselves with hydroponically grown food. After an extensive terraforming campaign, atmospheric conditions are now sufficient for hardy crops to be grown outdoors in some parts of the planet.
TEXT.French: For more than a century after colonization began, Martians had to content themselves with hydroponically grown food. After an extensive terraforming campaign, atmospheric conditions are now sufficient for hardy crops to be grown outdoors in some parts of the planet.

TEXT.English: The development of much more powerful ion beams, and advances in manufacturing technology generally, have allowed Martians to manufacture all manners of hitherto expensive goods. However, the factory is a loud and dingy place. Working conditions became so unpleasant that workers actually organized for the development of robots to take the jobs.
TEXT.French: The development of much more powerful ion beams, and advances in manufacturing technology generally, have allowed Martians to manufacture all manners of hitherto expensive goods. However, the factory is a loud and dingy place. Working conditions became so unpleasant that workers actually organized for the development of robots to take the jobs.

TEXT.English: This is no ordinary hydroponics facility. You already had that. The Martian Hydroponics Complex is a sprawling, multistory food factory that uses the latest advances in bioengineering and gastronomy. It still tastes like wet cardboard.
TEXT.French: This is no ordinary hydroponics facility. You already had that. The Martian Hydroponics Complex is a sprawling, multistory food factory that uses the latest advances in bioengineering and gastronomy. It still tastes like wet cardboard.

TEXT.English: Previously lacking good ways to get around, Martians built a maglev system even before Earth was fully connected. The thin atmosphere and low gravity keeps operating costs low. Teenagers have been seen to loiter at the stations and spend hours riding between cities for fun.
TEXT.French: Previously lacking good ways to get around, Martians built a maglev system even before Earth was fully connected. The thin atmosphere and low gravity keeps operating costs low. Teenagers have been seen to loiter at the stations and spend hours riding between cities for fun.

TEXT.English: It was a Martian engineer who first discovered how to apply recent advances in magnetic technology to building construction. He started a construction firm and built what would become the first city on Mars with a population over 100 million. Though the company failed from an ill-conceived mining venture, the construction technique became widespread.
TEXT.French: It was a Martian engineer who first discovered how to apply recent advances in magnetic technology to building construction. He started a construction firm and built what would become the first city on Mars with a population over 100 million. Though the company failed from an ill-conceived mining venture, the construction technique became widespread.

TEXT.English: As early as the dawn of the 22nd century, no one imagined that applying high amounts of energy to the Martian regolith would ever be a viable construction technique. But it is, and now there thousands of cities on Mars built in this manner.
TEXT.French: As early as the dawn of the 22nd century, no one imagined that applying high amounts of energy to the Martian regolith would ever be a viable construction technique. But it is, and now there thousands of cities on Mars built in this manner.

TEXT.English: The Martian regolith might be cold and devoid of life, but it contains all the materials needed to set up a self-replicating system of production.
TEXT.French: The Martian regolith might be cold and devoid of life, but it contains all the materials needed to set up a self-replicating system of production.

TEXT.English: Religion has been a central part of the human experience for as long as there have been humans. The same was true for the first full-fledged civilization on Mars, and as the Martians began to diverge culturally from Earthlings, they built temples to honor God as they understood Him.
TEXT.French: Religion has been a central part of the human experience for as long as there have been humans. The same was true for the first full-fledged civilization on Mars, and as the Martians began to diverge culturally from Earthlings, they built temples to honor God as they understood Him.

TEXT.English: This electromagnetic shield will protect your Mars colonists from charged radiation. Life is now slightly less miserable.
TEXT.French: This electromagnetic shield will protect your Mars colonists from charged radiation. Life is now slightly less miserable.

TEXT.English: Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) is a robotic space probe mission to Mars launched by NASA on November 26, 2011, which successfully landed Curiosity, a Mars rover, in Gale Crater on August 6, 2012. The overall objectives include investigating Mars' habitability, studying its climate and geology, and collecting data for a manned mission to Mars. The rover carries a variety of scientific instruments designed by an international team.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) is a robotic space probe mission to Mars launched by NASA on November 26, 2011, which successfully landed Curiosity, a Mars rover, in Gale Crater on August 6, 2012. The overall objectives include investigating Mars' habitability, studying its climate and geology, and collecting data for a manned mission to Mars. The rover carries a variety of scientific instruments designed by an international team.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Terraforming of Mars is well under way. A full-fledge sea, filled with Earthlike marine life, has been built.
TEXT.French: Terraforming of Mars is well under way. A full-fledge sea, filled with Earthlike marine life, has been built.

TEXT.English: The terraforming of Mars is the hypothetical process by which Mars' climate and surface would be deliberately changed to make large areas of the environment hospitable to humans, thus making the colonization of Mars safer and sustainable (see Planetary engineering).[PARAGRAPH:2]There are several proposed terraforming concepts, some of which present prohibitive economic and natural resource costs, and others that may be achievable with foreseeable technology.
TEXT.French: The terraforming of Mars is the hypothetical process by which Mars' climate and surface would be deliberately changed to make large areas of the environment hospitable to humans, thus making the colonization of Mars safer and sustainable (see Planetary engineering).[PARAGRAPH:2]There are several proposed terraforming concepts, some of which present prohibitive economic and natural resource costs, and others that may be achievable with foreseeable technology.

TEXT.English: With this spaceport, it is finally economical to ship goods from Mars back to Earth. Martians starting taking vacations to Earth, and it telling how many didn't come back.
TEXT.French: With this spaceport, it is finally economical to ship goods from Mars back to Earth. Martians starting taking vacations to Earth, and it telling how many didn't come back.

TEXT.English: Reducing the albedo of the Martian surface would also make more efficient use of incoming sunlight. This could be done by spreading dark dust from Mars's moons, Phobos and Deimos, which are among the blackest bodies in the Solar System; or by introducing dark extremophile microbial life forms such as lichens, algae and bacteria. The ground would then absorb more sunlight, warming the atmosphere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Reducing the albedo of the Martian surface would also make more efficient use of incoming sunlight. This could be done by spreading dark dust from Mars's moons, Phobos and Deimos, which are among the blackest bodies in the Solar System; or by introducing dark extremophile microbial life forms such as lichens, algae and bacteria. The ground would then absorb more sunlight, warming the atmosphere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Another more intricate method uses ammonia as a powerful greenhouse gas. It is possible that large amounts of it exist in frozen form on minor planets orbiting in the outer Solar System. It may be possible to move these and send them into Mars's atmosphere. Because ammonia (NH3) is mostly nitrogen by weight, it could also supply the buffer gas for the atmosphere. Sustained smaller impacts will also contribute to increases in the temperature and mass of the atmosphere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Another more intricate method uses ammonia as a powerful greenhouse gas. It is possible that large amounts of it exist in frozen form on minor planets orbiting in the outer Solar System. It may be possible to move these and send them into Mars's atmosphere. Because ammonia (NH3) is mostly nitrogen by weight, it could also supply the buffer gas for the atmosphere. Sustained smaller impacts will also contribute to increases in the temperature and mass of the atmosphere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A geotheromal (areothermal) power plant on Mars.
TEXT.French: A geotheromal (areothermal) power plant on Mars.

TEXT.English: Resources harvested from a captured asteroid around Mars.
TEXT.French: Resources harvested from a captured asteroid around Mars.

TEXT.English: Many early Martians lived in caves.
TEXT.French: Many early Martians lived in caves.

TEXT.English: Because long-term climate stability would be required for sustaining a human population, the use of especially powerful fluorine-bearing greenhouse gases, possibly including sulfur hexafluoride or halocarbons such as chlorofluorocarbons (or CFCs) and perfluorocarbons (or PFCs), has been suggested.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Because long-term climate stability would be required for sustaining a human population, the use of especially powerful fluorine-bearing greenhouse gases, possibly including sulfur hexafluoride or halocarbons such as chlorofluorocarbons (or CFCs) and perfluorocarbons (or PFCs), has been suggested.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: There is presently enough carbon dioxide (CO2) as dry ice in the Martian south pole and absorbed by regolith (soil) on Mars that, if sublimated to gas by a climate warming of only a few degrees, would increase the atmospheric pressure to 30 kilopascals (0.30 atm), comparable to the altitude of the peak of Mount Everest, where the atmospheric pressure is 33.7 kilopascals (0.333 atm). Although this would not be breathable by humans, it is above the Armstrong limit and would eliminate the present need for pressure suits. Phytoplankton can also convert dissolved CO2 into oxygen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: There is presently enough carbon dioxide (CO2) as dry ice in the Martian south pole and absorbed by regolith (soil) on Mars that, if sublimated to gas by a climate warming of only a few degrees, would increase the atmospheric pressure to 30 kilopascals (0.30 atm), comparable to the altitude of the peak of Mount Everest, where the atmospheric pressure is 33.7 kilopascals (0.333 atm). Although this would not be breathable by humans, it is above the Armstrong limit and would eliminate the present need for pressure suits. Phytoplankton can also convert dissolved CO2 into oxygen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A communication satellite. This transmits knowledge back to Earth and keeps the colonists better up to speed on what is happening on Earth. Not that what is happening on Earth is very interesting; that's why they left in the first place.
TEXT.French: A communication satellite. This transmits knowledge back to Earth and keeps the colonists better up to speed on what is happening on Earth. Not that what is happening on Earth is very interesting; that's why they left in the first place.

TEXT.English: The liquid fluoride thorium reactor (acronym LFTR; often pronounced lifter) is a type of molten salt reactor. LFTRs use the thorium fuel cycle with a fluoride-based, molten, liquid salt for fuel.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The liquid fluoride thorium reactor (acronym LFTR; often pronounced lifter) is a type of molten salt reactor. LFTRs use the thorium fuel cycle with a fluoride-based, molten, liquid salt for fuel.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.French: Magnetic field to protect life and the atmosphere.

TEXT.French: Giant orbital array of mirrors to collect solar power and increase surface heat.

TEXT.French: A thick and carefully climate-controlled skyscraper.

TEXT.English: Masdar City is a planned city project in Abu Dhabi, in the United Arab Emirates. It will host the headquarters of the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA). The city is designed to be a hub for cleantech companies. Its first tenant is the Masdar Institute of Science and Technology, which has been operating in the city since it moved into its campus in September 2010.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Masdar City is a planned city project in Abu Dhabi, in the United Arab Emirates. It will host the headquarters of the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA). The city is designed to be a hub for cleantech companies. Its first tenant is the Masdar Institute of Science and Technology, which has been operating in the city since it moved into its campus in September 2010.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The ultimate personal assembler, this device operates at the quantum gravity level and seems to create matter out of thin air.
TEXT.French: Ultime assembleur personnel, cet appareil fonctionne au niveau de la gravité quantique et semble créer de la matière à partir de l'air.

TEXT.English: The Mathematical Oracle operates at the upper limit of computation and can also almost any question, phrased mathematically, that can theoretically be answered.
TEXT.French: L'Oracle Mathématique opère à la limite supérieure du calcul et peut également répondre à presque toutes les questions, formulées mathématiquement, auxquelles on peut théoriquement répondre.

TEXT.English: A matrioshka brain is a hypothetical megastructure proposed by Robert Bradbury, based on the Dyson sphere, of immense computational capacity. It is an example of a Class B stellar engine, employing the entire energy output of a star to drive computer systems. This concept derives its name from Russian Matrioshka dolls. The concept was deployed by its inventor, Robert Bradbury, in the anthology Year Million: Science at the Far Edge of Knowledge, and attracted interest from reviewers in the Los Angeles Times and the Wall Street Journal. (Source: Wikipedia)
TEXT.French: A matrioshka brain is a hypothetical megastructure proposed by Robert Bradbury, based on the Dyson sphere, of immense computational capacity. It is an example of a Class B stellar engine, employing the entire energy output of a star to drive computer systems. This concept derives its name from Russian Matrioshka dolls. The concept was deployed by its inventor, Robert Bradbury, in the anthology Year Million: Science at the Far Edge of Knowledge, and attracted interest from reviewers in the Los Angeles Times and the Wall Street Journal. (Source: Wikipedia)

TEXT.English: Turns energy into matter in large quantities.
TEXT.French: Turns energy into matter in large quantities.

TEXT.English: Preserve highly unstable matter in a suspended state.
TEXT.French: Preserve highly unstable matter in a suspended state.

TEXT.English: A McKendree cylinder is a type of hypothetical rotating space habitat originally proposed at NASA's Turning Goals into Reality conference in 2000 by NASA engineer Tom McKendree. As with other space habitat designs, the cylinder would spin to produce artificial gravity by way of centrifugal force. The design differs from the classical designs produced in the 1970s by Gerard K. O'Neill and NASA in that it would use carbon nanotubes instead of steel, allowing the habitat to be built much larger. In the original proposal, the habitat would consist of two cylinders approximately 460 km (290 mi) in radius and 4600 km (2900 mi) in length, containing 13 million square kilometers (5.1 million square miles) of living space, nearly as much land area as that of Russia.
TEXT.French: Un cylindre McKendree est un type d'habitat spatial en rotation hypothétique initialement proposé lors de la conférence Turning Goals into Reality de la NASA en 2000 par l'ingénieur de la NASA Tom McKendree. Comme avec d'autres conceptions d'habitats spatiaux, le cylindre tournerait pour produire une gravité artificielle par le biais de la force centrifuge. La conception diffère des conceptions classiques produites dans les années 1970 par Gerard K. O'Neill et la NASA en ce qu'elle utiliserait des nanotubes de carbone à la place de l'acier, permettant à l'habitat d'être construit beaucoup plus grand. Dans la proposition originale, l'habitat se composerait de deux cylindres d'environ 460 km (290 mi) de rayon et 4600 km (2900 mi) de longueur, contenant 13 millions de kilomètres carrés (5,1 millions de milles carrés) d'espace vital, presque autant de terres région que celle de la Russie.

TEXT.English: Mechanosynthesis is a term for hypothetical chemical syntheses in which reaction outcomes are determined by the use of mechanical constraints to direct reactive molecules to specific molecular sites. There are presently no chemical syntheses which achieve this aim. Some atomic placement has been achieved with scanning tunnelling microscopes.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Mechanosynthesis is a term for hypothetical chemical syntheses in which reaction outcomes are determined by the use of mechanical constraints to direct reactive molecules to specific molecular sites. There are presently no chemical syntheses which achieve this aim. Some atomic placement has been achieved with scanning tunnelling microscopes.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.French: Highly advanced facility provides many medical functions and also manufactures medical devices.

TEXT.English: Headquarters for a vile and highly profitable megacorporation.
TEXT.French: Headquarters for a vile and highly profitable megacorporation.

TEXT.English: This is a high tech and highly civilized city that spans star systems.
TEXT.French: This is a high tech and highly civilized city that spans star systems.

TEXT.English: This portal leads beyond the observable universe.
TEXT.French: This portal leads beyond the observable universe.

TEXT.English: A meme is 'an idea, behavior, or style that spreads from person to person within a culture'. A meme acts as a unit for carrying cultural ideas, symbols, or practices that can be transmitted from one mind to another through writing, speech, gestures, rituals, or other imitable phenomena with a mimicked theme. Supporters of the concept regard memes as cultural analogues to genes in that they self-replicate, mutate, and respond to selective pressures.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Un mème est «une idée, un comportement ou un style qui se propage d'une personne à l'autre au sein d'une culture». Un mème agit comme une unité pour transporter des idées, des symboles ou des pratiques culturelles qui peuvent être transmises d'un esprit à un autre par l'écriture, le discours, les gestes, les rituels ou d'autres phénomènes imitables avec un thème imité. Les partisans du concept considèrent les mèmes comme des analogues culturels des gènes en ce qu'ils s'auto-répliquent, mutent et répondent à des pressions sélectives. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A facility that transfers memories from one person to another.
TEXT.French: A facility that transfers memories from one person to another.

TEXT.English: Most of the surface of Mercury has been dedicated to solar panels to harness energy for the production of antimatter.
TEXT.French: Most of the surface of Mercury has been dedicated to solar panels to harness energy for the production of antimatter.

TEXT.English: Now that you have an effective way to block the sun's intense heat, you can build colonies all over Mercury. While it is not the most exciting place to live, the intense solar radiation, lack of atmosphere, and low gravity are great for industry.
TEXT.French: Now that you have an effective way to block the sun's intense heat, you can build colonies all over Mercury. While it is not the most exciting place to live, the intense solar radiation, lack of atmosphere, and low gravity are great for industry.

TEXT.English: Various metals, together with oxygen, can form very complex and thermally stable structures rivaling those of organic compounds; the heteropoly acids are one such family. Some metal oxides are also similar to carbon in their ability to form both nanotube structures and diamond-like crystals (such as cubic zirconia). Titanium, aluminium, magnesium, and iron are all more abundant in the Earth's crust than carbon. Metal-oxide-based life could therefore be a possibility under certain conditions, including those (such as high temperatures) at which carbon-based life would be unlikely. The Cronin group at Glasgow University reported self-assembly of tungsten polyoxometallates into cell-like spheres. By modifying their metal oxide content, the spheres can acquire holes that act as porous membrane, selectively allowing chemicals in and out of the sphere according to size.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Methane (CH4) is a simple hydrocarbon: that is, a compound of two of the most common elements in the cosmos, hydrogen and carbon. It has a cosmic abundance comparable with ammonia. Hydrocarbons could act as a solvent over a wide range of temperatures, but would lack polarity. Isaac Asimov, the biochemist and science fiction writer, suggested in 1981 that poly-lipids could form a substitute for proteins in a non-polar solvent such as methane. Lakes composed of a mixture of hydrocarbons, including methane and ethane, have been detected on the surface of Titan by the Cassini spacecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Methane (CH4) is a simple hydrocarbon: that is, a compound of two of the most common elements in the cosmos, hydrogen and carbon. It has a cosmic abundance comparable with ammonia. Hydrocarbons could act as a solvent over a wide range of temperatures, but would lack polarity. Isaac Asimov, the biochemist and science fiction writer, suggested in 1981 that poly-lipids could form a substitute for proteins in a non-polar solvent such as methane. Lakes composed of a mixture of hydrocarbons, including methane and ethane, have been detected on the surface of Titan by the Cassini spacecraft.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The metric system is an internationally adopted decimal system of measurement. It is in widespread use, and where it is used, it is the only or most common system of weights and measures. It is now known as the International System of Units (SI). It is used to measure everyday things such as a sack of flour, the height of a person, a tank of petrol, and the speed of a car. It is also used in science, industry and trade.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The metric system is an internationally adopted decimal system of measurement. It is in widespread use, and where it is used, it is the only or most common system of weights and measures. It is now known as the International System of Units (SI). It is used to measure everyday things such as a sack of flour, the height of a person, a tank of petrol, and the speed of a car. It is also used in science, industry and trade.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Hilbert's problems are twenty-three problems in mathematics published by German mathematician David Hilbert in 1900. The problems were all unsolved at the time, and several of them were very influential for 20th-century mathematics. Hilbert presented ten of the problems (1, 2, 6, 7, 8, 13, 16, 19, 21 and 22) at the Paris conference of the International Congress of Mathematicians, speaking on August 8 in the Sorbonne. The complete list of 23 problems was published later, most notably in English translation in 1902 by Mary Frances Winston Newson in the Bulletin of the American Mathematical Society.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Les problèmes de Hilbert sont vingt-trois problèmes de mathématiques publiés par le mathématicien allemand David Hilbert en 1900. Tous les problèmes n'étaient pas résolus à l'époque, et plusieurs d'entre eux étaient très influents pour les mathématiques du XXe siècle. Hilbert a présenté dix des problèmes (1, 2, 6, 7, 8, 13, 16, 19, 21 et 22) à la conférence de Paris du Congrès international des mathématiciens, s'exprimant le 8 août à la Sorbonne. La liste complète de 23 problèmes a été publiée plus tard, notamment en traduction anglaise en 1902 par Mary Frances Winston Newson dans le Bulletin de l'Américain Mathematical Society. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Mir was a space station that operated in low Earth orbit from 1986 to 2001, owned by the Soviet Union and later by Russia. Mir was the first modular space station and was assembled in orbit from 1986 to 1996. It had a greater mass than any previous spacecraft. Until 21 March 2001 it was the largest artificial satellite in orbit, succeeded by the International Space Station after Mir's orbit decayed. The station served as a microgravity research laboratory in which crews conducted experiments in biology, human biology, physics, astronomy, meteorology and spacecraft systems with a goal of developing technologies required for permanent occupation of space.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Mir was a space station that operated in low Earth orbit from 1986 to 2001, owned by the Soviet Union and later by Russia. Mir was the first modular space station and was assembled in orbit from 1986 to 1996. It had a greater mass than any previous spacecraft. Until 21 March 2001 it was the largest artificial satellite in orbit, succeeded by the International Space Station after Mir's orbit decayed. The station served as a microgravity research laboratory in which crews conducted experiments in biology, human biology, physics, astronomy, meteorology and spacecraft systems with a goal of developing technologies required for permanent occupation of space.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A human mission to Mars has been the subject of science fiction, engineering, and scientific proposals throughout the 20th century and into the 21st century. The plans comprise proposals to land on Mars, eventually settling on and terraforming the planet, while utilizing its moons, Phobos and Deimos.[PARAGRAPH:2]The exploration of Mars has been a goal of national space programs for decades. Preliminary work for missions that would involve human explorers has been undertaken since the 1950s, with planned missions typically being cited as taking place 10 to 30 years in the future when they are drafted. The list of manned Mars mission plans in the 20th century shows the various mission proposals that have been put forth by multiple organizations and space agencies in this field of space exploration. Nonetheless, a human mission to Mars has been criticized for minimizing the 'harsh realities and bitter truths that underlie the dream'.[PARAGRAPH:2]In terms of the current U.S. space program, NASA's long-term program Orion has a projected pace of development such that, as of late 2014, human spaceflight to Mars is anticipated in about 2035. That mission will be preceded by shorter flights for the up to four-person capsule involved, with experiments taking place to better the technologies protecting Mars-bound astronauts from the radiation of deep space. In October 2015, NASA presented the next steps in the effort in more detail, as well as a related health hazards report.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: A human mission to Mars has been the subject of science fiction, engineering, and scientific proposals throughout the 20th century and into the 21st century. The plans comprise proposals to land on Mars, eventually settling on and terraforming the planet, while utilizing its moons, Phobos and Deimos.[PARAGRAPH:2]The exploration of Mars has been a goal of national space programs for decades. Preliminary work for missions that would involve human explorers has been undertaken since the 1950s, with planned missions typically being cited as taking place 10 to 30 years in the future when they are drafted. The list of manned Mars mission plans in the 20th century shows the various mission proposals that have been put forth by multiple organizations and space agencies in this field of space exploration. Nonetheless, a human mission to Mars has been criticized for minimizing the 'harsh realities and bitter truths that underlie the dream'.[PARAGRAPH:2]In terms of the current U.S. space program, NASA's long-term program Orion has a projected pace of development such that, as of late 2014, human spaceflight to Mars is anticipated in about 2035. That mission will be preceded by shorter flights for the up to four-person capsule involved, with experiments taking place to better the technologies protecting Mars-bound astronauts from the radiation of deep space. In October 2015, NASA presented the next steps in the effort in more detail, as well as a related health hazards report.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Mixed-use development is a type of urban development that blends residential, commercial, cultural, institutional, or industrial uses, where those functions are physically and functionally integrated, and that provides pedestrian connections.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Plants that can move. So they're not really plants.
TEXT.French: Des Usines qui peuvent se déplacer. Ce ne sont donc pas vraiment des usines implantées.

TEXT.English: Modular buildings and modular homes are sectional prefabricated buildings, or houses, that consist of multiple sections called modules. 'Modular' is a method of construction differing from other methods of building. The module sections are constructed at an off site (sometimes, remote) facility, then delivered to the intended site of use. Complete construction of the prefabricated sections are completed on site. The prefabricated sections are sometimes lifted and placed on basement walls using a crane, the module prefabricated sections are set onto the building's foundation and joined together to make a single building. The modules can be placed side-by-side, end-to-end, or stacked, allowing a wide variety of configurations and styles in the building layout.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Modular buildings and modular homes are sectional prefabricated buildings, or houses, that consist of multiple sections called modules. 'Modular' is a method of construction differing from other methods of building. The module sections are constructed at an off site (sometimes, remote) facility, then delivered to the intended site of use. Complete construction of the prefabricated sections are completed on site. The prefabricated sections are sometimes lifted and placed on basement walls using a crane, the module prefabricated sections are set onto the building's foundation and joined together to make a single building. The modules can be placed side-by-side, end-to-end, or stacked, allowing a wide variety of configurations and styles in the building layout.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A molecular assembler, as defined by K. Eric Drexler, is a 'proposed device able to guide chemical reactions by positioning reactive molecules with atomic precision'. A molecular assembler is a kind of molecular machine. Some biological molecules such as ribosomes fit this definition. This is because they receive instructions from messenger RNA and then assemble specific sequences of amino acids to construct protein molecules. However, the term 'molecular assembler' usually refers to theoretical human-made devices.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Un assembleur moléculaire, tel que défini par K. Eric Drexler, est un «dispositif proposé capable de guider les réactions chimiques en positionnant des molécules réactives avec une précision atomique». Un assembleur moléculaire est une sorte de machine moléculaire. Certaines molécules biologiques telles que les ribosomes correspondent à cette définition. En effet, ils reçoivent des instructions de l'ARN messager et assemblent ensuite des séquences spécifiques d'acides aminés pour construire des molécules de protéines. Cependant, le terme «assembleur moléculaire» fait généralement référence aux dispositifs théoriques fabriqués par l'homme. [PARAGRAPH:2] Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The Molecular Disruption Device, also known as the Molecular Detachment Device, M.D. Device, Doctor Device, or Little Doctor as a play on the acronym, was a powerful weapon designed and built by the International Fleet.[PARAGRAPH:2] See http://enderverse.wikia.com/wiki/Molecular_Disruption_Device
TEXT.French: The Molecular Disruption Device, also known as the Molecular Detachment Device, M.D. Device, Doctor Device, or Little Doctor as a play on the acronym, was a powerful weapon designed and built by the International Fleet.[PARAGRAPH:2] See http://enderverse.wikia.com/wiki/Molecular_Disruption_Device

TEXT.English: The Google Lunar XPRIZE (GLXP), sometimes referred to as Moon 2.0, is an inducement prize space competition organized by XPRIZE, and sponsored by Google. The challenge calls for privately funded spaceflight teams to be the first to land a privately funded robotic spacecraft on the Moon, travel 500 meters, and transmit back high-definition video and images.[PARAGRAPH:2] -Wikipedia

The challenge calls for privately funded spaceflight teams to be the first to land a privately funded robotic spacecraft on the Moon, travel 500 meters, and transmit back high-definition video and images.[PARAGRAPH:2] -Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Morse code is a character encoding scheme used in telecommunication that encodes text characters as standardized sequences of two different signal durations called dots and dashes or dits and dahs. Morse code is named for Samuel F. B. Morse, an inventor of the telegraph.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Le code Morse est un schéma de codage de caractères utilisé dans les télécommunications qui code les caractères de texte sous forme de séquences normalisées de deux durées de signal différentes appelées points et tirets ou points et dahs. Le code Morse doit son nom à Samuel F. B. Morse, inventeur du télégraphe. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Multivac is the name of a fictional supercomputer appearing in several science fiction stories by American writer Isaac Asimov. According to his autobiography In Memory Yet Green, Asimov coined the name in imitation of UNIVAC, an early mainframe computer. Asimov had assumed the name 'Univac' denoted a computer with a single vacuum tube (it actually is an acronym for 'Universal Automatic Computer'), and on the basis that a computer with many such tubes would be more powerful, called his fictional computer 'Multivac'. His later short story 'The Last Question', however, expands the AC suffix to be 'automatic computer'.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Multivac est le nom d'un superordinateur fictif apparaissant dans plusieurs histoires de science-fiction de l'écrivain américain Isaac Asimov. Selon son autobiographie In Memory Yet Green, Asimov a inventé le nom à l'imitation d'UNIVAC, un des premiers ordinateurs centraux. Asimov avait supposé que le nom `` Univac '' désignait un ordinateur avec un seul tube à vide (c'est en fait un acronyme pour `` Universal Automatic Computer ''), et sur la base qu'un ordinateur avec beaucoup de tels tubes serait plus puissant, appelé son ordinateur fictif «Multivac». Cependant, sa nouvelle histoire plus récente, «The Last Question», élargit le suffixe AC en «ordinateur automatique». [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Nanofabrics are textiles engineered with small particles that give ordinary materials advantageous properties such as superhydrophobicity (extreme water resistance, also see 'Lotus effect'), odor and moisture elimination, increased elasticity and strength, and bacterial resistance. Depending on the desired property, a nanofabric is either constructed from nanoscopic fibers called nanofibers, or is formed by applying a solution containing nanoparticles to a regular fabric. Nanofabrics research is an interdisciplinary effort involving bioengineering, molecular chemistry, physics, electrical engineering, computer science, and systems engineering. Applications of nanofabrics have the potential to revolutionize textile manufacturing and areas of medicine such as drug delivery and tissue engineering.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Nanofabrics are textiles engineered with small particles that give ordinary materials advantageous properties such as superhydrophobicity (extreme water resistance, also see 'Lotus effect'), odor and moisture elimination, increased elasticity and strength, and bacterial resistance. Depending on the desired property, a nanofabric is either constructed from nanoscopic fibers called nanofibers, or is formed by applying a solution containing nanoparticles to a regular fabric. Nanofabrics research is an interdisciplinary effort involving bioengineering, molecular chemistry, physics, electrical engineering, computer science, and systems engineering. Applications of nanofabrics have the potential to revolutionize textile manufacturing and areas of medicine such as drug delivery and tissue engineering.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: A census is the procedure of systematically acquiring and recording information about the members of a given population. The term is used mostly in connection with national population and housing censuses; other common censuses include agriculture, business, and traffic censuses. The United Nations defines the essential features of population and housing censuses as 'individual enumeration, universality within a defined territory, simultaneity and defined periodicity', and recommends that population censuses be taken at least every 10 years. United Nations recommendations also cover census topics to be collected, official definitions, classifications and other useful information to co-ordinate international practice.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Un recensement est la procédure d'acquisition et d'enregistrement systématique d'informations sur les membres d'une population donnée. Le terme est utilisé principalement dans le cadre des recensements nationaux de la population et du logement; les autres recensements courants comprennent les recensements de l'agriculture, des entreprises et de la circulation. L'ONU définit les caractéristiques essentielles des recensements de la population et du logement comme étant `` le dénombrement individuel, l'universalité dans un territoire défini, la simultanéité et la périodicité définies '', et recommande que les recensements de population soient effectués au moins tous les 10 ans. Les recommandations des Nations Unies couvrent également les thèmes du recensement à collecter, les définitions officielles, les classifications et autres informations utiles pour coordonner les pratiques internationales. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: An nature goddess has arised from your civilization's immense knowledge and power.

TEXT.English: Neutrino astronomy is the branch of astronomy that observes astronomical objects with neutrino detectors in special observatories. Neutrinos are created as a result of certain types of radioactive decay, or nuclear reactions such as those that take place in the Sun, in nuclear reactors, or when cosmic rays hit atoms. Due to their weak interactions with matter, neutrinos offer a unique opportunity to observe processes that are inaccessible to optical telescopes.[PARAGRAPH:2]The field of neutrino astronomy is still very much in its infancy - the only confirmed extraterrestrial sources so far are the Sun and supernova SN1987A.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Neutrino astronomy is the branch of astronomy that observes astronomical objects with neutrino detectors in special observatories. Neutrinos are created as a result of certain types of radioactive decay, or nuclear reactions such as those that take place in the Sun, in nuclear reactors, or when cosmic rays hit atoms. Due to their weak interactions with matter, neutrinos offer a unique opportunity to observe processes that are inaccessible to optical telescopes.[PARAGRAPH:2]The field of neutrino astronomy is still very much in its infancy - the only confirmed extraterrestrial sources so far are the Sun and supernova SN1987A.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: What happens after this is speculative. It is possible that a Big Rip or a Big Freeze event may occur far off into the future. The former singularity takes place at a finite scale factor while the latter occurs at an infinitely large radius. Also, the universe may enter a second inflationary epoch, or, assuming that the current vacuum state is a false vacuum, the vacuum may decay into a lower-energy state.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: New Horizons is an interplanetary space probe that was launched as a part of NASA's New Frontiers program. Engineered by the Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) and the Southwest Research Institute (SwRI), with a team led by S. Alan Stern, the spacecraft was launched with the primary mission to perform a flyby study of the Pluto system, and a secondary mission to fly by and study one or more other Kuiper belt objects (KBOs).[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia
TEXT.French: New Horizons is an interplanetary space probe that was launched as a part of NASA's New Frontiers program. Engineered by the Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) and the Southwest Research Institute (SwRI), with a team led by S. Alan Stern, the spacecraft was launched with the primary mission to perform a flyby study of the Pluto system, and a secondary mission to fly by and study one or more other Kuiper belt objects (KBOs).[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Wikipedia

TEXT.English: NGC 6811 is an open cluster in the constellation of Cygnus, near the constellation of Lyra. It has an angular size half that of the full Moon and includes about 1000 stars of roughly similar magnitude. It has also been called 'The Hole in the Cluster' because of its dark center.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: NGC 6811 is an open cluster in the constellation of Cygnus, near the constellation of Lyra. It has an angular size half that of the full Moon and includes about 1000 stars of roughly similar magnitude. It has also been called 'The Hole in the Cluster' because of its dark center.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The Containers Skyscraper is an idea to provide nomad housing to this specific type of urban dweller. It consists of an exoskeleton where regular shipping containers transformed into apartment units plug-in. The main structure provides basic infrastructure as well as recreational areas while the habitable units can be transported by ship, truck, and train to almost every large city worldwide providing a sense of 'home' to these modern urban nomads.[PARAGRAPH:2]http://www.evolo.us/architecture/nomad-skyscraper/
TEXT.French: Le Gratte-ciel de Containers est une idée pour fournir un logement nomade à ce type spécifique de citadin. Il se compose d'un exosquelette où les conteneurs d'expédition réguliers se transforment en plug-ins d'appartements. La structure principale fournit des infrastructures de base ainsi que des zones de loisirs tandis que les unités habitables peuvent être transportées par bateau, camion et train vers presque toutes les grandes villes du monde, offrant un sentiment de «chez-soi» à ces nomades urbains modernes. [PARAGRAPH:2] http : //www.evolo.us/architecture/nomad-skyscraper/

TEXT.English: Myco-heterotrophy is a symbiotic relationship between certain kinds of plants and fungi, in which the plant gets all or part of its food from parasitism upon fungi rather than from photosynthesis. A myco-heterotroph is the parasitic plant partner in this relationship. Myco-heterotrophy is considered a kind of cheating relationship and myco-heterotrophs are sometimes informally referred to as 'mycorrhizal cheaters'. This relationship is sometimes referred to as mycotrophy, though this term is also used for plants that engage in mutualistic mycorrhizal relationships.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Myco-heterotrophy is a symbiotic relationship between certain kinds of plants and fungi, in which the plant gets all or part of its food from parasitism upon fungi rather than from photosynthesis. A myco-heterotroph is the parasitic plant partner in this relationship. Myco-heterotrophy is considered a kind of cheating relationship and myco-heterotrophs are sometimes informally referred to as 'mycorrhizal cheaters'. This relationship is sometimes referred to as mycotrophy, though this term is also used for plants that engage in mutualistic mycorrhizal relationships.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: Nootropics-also called smart drugs or cognitive enhancers-are drugs, supplements, or other substances that improve cognitive function, particularly executive functions, memory, creativity, or motivation, in healthy individuals. The use of cognition-enhancing drugs by healthy individuals in the absence of a medical indication is one of the most debated topics among neuroscientists, psychiatrists, and physicians which spans a number of issues, including the ethics and fairness of their use, concerns over adverse effects, and the diversion of prescription drugs for nonmedical uses, among others. Nonetheless, the international sales of cognition-enhancing supplements exceeded US$1 billion in 2015 and the global demand for these compounds is still growing rapidly.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: Les nootropiques - également appelés médicaments intelligents ou activateurs cognitifs - sont des médicaments, des suppléments ou d'autres substances qui améliorent la fonction cognitive, en particulier les fonctions exécutives, la mémoire, la créativité ou la motivation, chez les individus en bonne santé. L'utilisation de médicaments améliorant la cognition par des personnes en bonne santé en l'absence d'indication médicale est l'un des sujets les plus débattus parmi les neuroscientifiques, les psychiatres et les médecins qui couvre un certain nombre de questions, y compris l'éthique et l'équité de leur utilisation, les préoccupations concernant les effets indésirables et le détournement de médicaments sur ordonnance à des fins non médicales, entre autres. Néanmoins, les ventes internationales de suppléments améliorant la cognition ont dépassé le milliard de dollars américains en 2015 et la demande mondiale de ces composés continue de croître rapidement. [PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
Colonie de Norma and Outer Arm

TEXT.English: The Norma Arm is a minor spiral arm of the Milky Way extending from and around its central hub region. The inner portion of the Arm is called Norma Arm in narrow meaning. The outer part of it is identified either with Cygnus Arm, which lies outside the Perseus Arm, or Outer Arm, which is located further away from the center of the Galaxy than Cygnus Arm. Norma Arm has a radius of 15.5 +- 2.8 kpc. It is named for the Norma constellation, through which the Arm as seen from Earth passes.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia
TEXT.French: The Norma Arm is a minor spiral arm of the Voie lactée extending from and around its central hub region. The inner portion of the Arm is called Norma Arm in narrow meaning. The outer part of it is identified either with Cygnus Arm, which lies outside the Perseus Arm, or Outer Arm, which is located further away from the center of the Galaxy than Cygnus Arm. Norma Arm has a radius of 15.5 +- 2.8 kpc. It is named for the Norma constellation, through which the Arm as seen from Earth passes.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The Nuclear Damper is featured in the science fiction Traveler (role-playing game); where the device manipulates the strong nuclear force within a field. Applications include accelerating the speed at which radioactive particles shed radiation until they are inert; as well as preventing nuclear decay by raising the potential barrier around the nuclei. The nuclear damper can also be used to cause nuclear warheads to shed neutrons at lower energies by lowering the potential barrier.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

The nuclear damper can also be used to cause nuclear warheads to shed neutrons at lower energies by lowering the potential barrier.[PARAGRAPH:2] Wikipedia

TEXT.English: The overall form of Nudging Space is intended to create various micro-climatic environments within the building envelopes. To do this Soleri utilizes the concept of 'garment architecture' to moderate thermal and lighting conditions. The hot season garment is opaque, providing shade while the cold season garment is transparent and transmits the solar energy and traps the heated air. Furthermore, its curved space offers a focusing convergence that may encourage positive human interaction.
TEXT.French: La forme globale de la Stratosphère est destinée à créer divers environnements micro-climatiques dans les enveloppes du bâtiment. Pour ce faire, Soleri utilise le concept d '«architecture du vêtement» pour modérer les conditions thermiques et d'éclairage. Le vêtement de saison chaude est opaque, fournissant de l'ombre tandis que le vêtement de saison froide est transparent et transmet l'énergie solaire et emprisonne l'air chauffé. De plus, son espace incurvé offre une convergence focalisée qui peut encourager une interaction humaine positive.

TEXT.English: Trevelyan, also known as Shield 0006 or XF-063 and formerly known as Onyx, was a planet-sized Forerunner construct located in the Zeta Doradus system. While it had a Human habitable surface and a seemingly terrestrial crust, internally, it was actually composed of trillions of Onyx Sentinels. Onyx's ultimate purpose was to guard the entrance to a Shield World. It was the location of the massive, three-sided Battle of Onyx.[PARAGRAPH:2] Halo: http://halo.wikia.com/wiki/Trevelyan

TEXT.English: Through decentralized collaboration and changes to patent law, the technology needed for most manufacturing and commerce is now open source. Since control of knowledge and patents is one of the central bases of power in the Information Age, the advent of widespread open source technology marked the beginning of the transition to a truly egalitarian society.
TEXT.French: Through decentralized collaboration and changes to patent law, the technology needed for most manufacturing and commerce is now open source. Since control of knowledge and patents is one of the central bases of power in the Information Age, the advent of widespread open source technology marked the beginning of the transition to a truly egalitarian society.

TEXT.English: An optical computer (also called a photonic computer) is a device that uses the photons in visible light or infrared ( IR ) beams,rather than electric current, to perform digital computations. An electric current flows at only about 10 percent of the speed of light. This limits the rate at which data can be exchanged over long distances, and is one of the factors that led to the evolution of optical fiber. By applying some of the advantages of visible and/or IR networks at the device and component scale, a computer might someday be developed that can perform operations 10 or more times faster than a conventional electronic computer.[PARAGRAPH:2] See http://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/optical-computer-photonic-computer
TEXT.French: An optical computer (also called a photonic computer) is a device that uses the photons in visible light or infrared ( IR ) beams,rather than electric current, to perform digital computations. TEXT.English: Particle accelerators on Earth, such as the Large Hadron Collider, yielded tremendously valuable information about the subatomic world. Nevertheless, efforts to unify the branches of physics continued to be fruitless, and more experimental evidence was needed. Earthbound accelerators could no longer provide enough energy, and so the International Orbital Accelerator was built.

TEXT.English: The O'Neill cylinder (also called an O'Neill colony) is a space settlement design proposed by American physicist Gerard K. O'Neill in his 1976 book The High Frontier: Human Colonies in Space. O'Neill proposed the colonization of space for the 21st century, using materials extracted from the Moon and later from asteroids. (Source: Wikipedia)[PARAGRAPH:2]In C2C, this is the first megastructure not tied to a planetary orbit; these colonies orbit the Sun and travel throughout the solar system freely. They serve functions of trade and knowledge exchange. Artifical gravity is nice, too.
